missionProperties.repositionOverride: Enter the Safe Room and block the Rebel's access to it.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

After delivering the supplies, you hear a young boy pleading just outside. “I don’t know who’s leading the guerrillas... I mean radicals!” The two Trandoshans don’t appreciate your intervention. By the time the Wing Guard arrive, it’s too late to avoid a fight.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Doors are locked to Imperial figures.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.tbText: Caught in the cross-fire, civilians begin to panic. Some even throw rocks, believing you to be the aggressors. Right or wrong, without action, this scuffle could cost innocent lives.

{-} Neutral mission tokens represent citizens.
{-} Heroes gain {A}: Test {J}. Before rolling, you may suffer up to 2{C} to apply +1 {B} to the results for each {C} suffered. You may push each citizen within 3 spaces of you a number of spaces equal to your successes.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
This is the panic control token.

{-} When a hero in line of sight of 1 or more citizens declares an attack, click "Increase Panic".
{-} At the end of each Round, before clicking on "End Round", click "Trigger Panic".

eventActions.tbText:
This is the panic control token.

{-} When a hero in line of sight of 1 or more citizens declares an attack, click the panic control token and select "Increase Panic".
{-} At the end of each Round, before clicking on "End Round", click the panic control token and select "Trigger Panic".
{-} When all citizens are on the Safe Room, there are no Imperial figures on the Safe Room, and all doors are closed, the citizens are safe. Click the panic control token and select "Citizens safe".
{-} The heroes win when the citizens are safe.

eventActions.shortText: Take the citizens to the Safe Room. Panic: &Panic&

eventActions.theText:
{-} Doors are locked to Imperial figures.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent citizens.
{-} When a hero in line of sight of 1 or more citizens declares an attack, click the panic control token and select "Increase Panic".
{-} At the end of each Round, before clicking on "End Round", click the panic control token and select "Trigger Panic".
{-} Heroes gain {A}: Test {J}. Before rolling, you may suffer up to 2{C} to apply +1 {B} to the results for each {C} suffered. You may push each citizen within 3 spaces of you a number of spaces equal to your successes.
{-} When all citizens are on the Safe Room, there are no Imperial figures on the Safe Room, and all doors are closed, the citizens are safe. Click the panic control token and select "Citizens safe".
{-} The heroes win when the citizens are safe.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
Imperials pound on the doors, but they hold. Safely reunited with their families, many of the civilians apologize for their confusion. After witnessing the disregard the Empire showed, a few even pledge to join the guerrillas.

Staying here will only endanger these people again. You leave what provisions you can afford to before leading the Imperials away and disappearing into Cloud City.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!

eventActions.mainText: Did you play this mission as part of the "The Bespin Gambit" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
Unable to get everybody to safety, you have to take some chances to escape. It’s impossible to know if anyone was injured. Headlines tomorrow will read “Guerrillas Endanger Civilians",  and few will challenge them.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.mainText: Did you play this mission as part of the "The Bespin Gambit" mini campaign?

events.eventText: Panic reaches 1, "Panic events active" set to 1
Panic reaches 0, "Panic events active" and "Panic events trigger" set to 0

Panic Event

Panic -1
Panic events trigger 0
Panic events reset 1

Panic Event Reset

Panic events trigger set to 1
Panic events reset set to 0

The citizens scream and run away in terror.

{-} Move the 2 citizens that are closest to the Safe Room, but not on the Safe Room, 1 space away from the Safe Room.

The panicking crowd pushes and jostles you around, almost trampling you.

{-} If {rebel} is within 3 spaces and in line of sight of a citizen, roll 1 blue die. {rebel} suffers {H} equal to the {H} results. Otherwise, choose any other Rebel within 3 spaces and in line of sight of a citizen to suffer the {H}.
The panicked screams echo through Cloud City, alarming more enemy forces to the scene.
The door slides open.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: A sturdy door leads into the safe room.

events.eventText: The door slides open.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: A sturdy door leads into the safe room.

events.eventText: The door slides open.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: A sturdy door leads into the safe room.

events.eventText: The door slams shut.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: A sturdy door leads into the safe room.

events.eventText: The door slams shut.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: A sturdy door leads into the safe room.

events.eventText: The room behind is spacious and brightly lit, perfectly suited to keep the citizens safe.

eventActions.tbText: In the middle of the room, a control panel controls the lockdown mechanisms of the Safe Room.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The door control panel sits in the middle of the conference room. It can be used to close the doors of the Safe Room.

eventActions.tbText: {-} A hero can interact with the terminal to close a door.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Doors are locked to Imperial figures.
{-} A hero can interact with the terminal to close a door.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent citizens.
{-} When a hero in line of sight of 1 or more citizens declares an attack, click the panic control token and select "Increase Panic".
{-} At the end of each Round, before clicking on "End Round", click the panic control token and select "Trigger Panic".
{-} Heroes gain {A}: Test {J}. Before rolling, you may suffer up to 2{C} to apply +1 {B} to the results for each {C} suffered. You may push each citizen within 3 spaces of you a number of spaces equal to your successes.
{-} When all citizens are on the Safe Room, there are no Imperial figures on the Safe Room, and all doors are closed, the citizens are safe. Click the panic control token and select "Citizens safe".
{-} The heroes win when the citizens are safe.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
<color="red">Reminder:</color>
{-} When a hero in line of sight of 1 or more citizens declares an attack, click the panic control token and select "Increase Panic".
{-} At the end of each Round, before clicking on "End Round", click the panic control token and select "Trigger Panic".

Another door bursts open, and in steps the intimidating figure of the bounty hunter Bossk, accompanied by an angry security officer. "There they are! Stop them! What are we paying you for?", the officer shouts.
Murne Rin gains the “Cam Droid” Reward card.
The heroes receive 150 credits per hero.

The presence of notorious bounty hunter Bossk on Cloud City concerns you. He doesn’t take small contracts, which means he’s here for something big; something like Imperial codes.

Worries subside as you return to headquarters and find a few fresh faces. Your restraint in the earlier battle has pulled public support to your side. The people are tired of mistreatment, and at least a few are willing to take a stand.

The boy whom you saved from Trandoshans before the fight steps forward. “Thanks for helping me, but many were captured before you arrived. If you can free them, I’m sure we'll have enough support to lead a true rebellion!”

The sentiment is sweet, but the boy also makes a point. As the guerrilla ranks grow, so do your resources and your chances of finding the codes. You set out immediately to find the missing civilians.

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} The next active mission is “Freedom Fighters”.

Your mission has gotten complicated, and you struggle to piece it all together. Why are Trandoshans pestering civilians about guerrillas? How are they able to get away with it in front of the Wing Guard? And why would a bounty hunter as notorious as Bossk be on Cloud City?

At headquarters, you find it difficult to convince the soldiers to stay. Public support is waning, and with mercenaries roaming the streets freely, the dangers of being associated with the Rebellion have become tangible.

Dangerous or not, you still have a mission. Rumors that Bossk is turning a profit in this chaos by selling slaves only steel your resolve. If these lizards want a part in this conflict, then you'll bring the fight to them.

{-} Each hero receives 2 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} The next active mission is “Freedom Fighters”.

{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
